Christopher Knight Finance Overview

Christopher Knight’s journey from a child actor to a successful businessman is a fascinating one. He began his career at a young age, landing commercials and guest roles on popular TV shows. However, his breakout role came as Peter Brady on The Brady Bunch, which significantly contributed to his early wealth.

After The Brady Bunch ended, Knight made several guest appearances on other television shows and even appeared in a few films. Despite these roles, he decided to shift his focus from acting to business in 1988. His decision to enter the computer industry proved to be lucrative.

As an account sales manager at Martec, Inc., he landed the company’s first $1 million deal and was named Employee of the Year. This success led him to become the Vice President of Design System Marketing and Sales at New Image Industry.

In 1991, Knight co-founded Visual Software, a pioneering 3D graphics company. The company experienced significant growth under his leadership, increasing its annual sales from $0.4 million to $4.2 million in just 10 months. Visual Software was later acquired by Micrografx.

Knight continued his entrepreneurial journey by founding Kidwise Learningware in 1995, which focused on interactive educational products for children. He then joined Adesso as Vice President of Sales, where he doubled the company’s sales within four months. His next venture was with Integrated Micro Solutions (iXMicro), where he helped increase annual sales from less than $2 million to $63 million in just one year.

In 1998, Knight founded Eskape Labs, a company specializing in TV tuner devices. Eskape Labs was acquired by Hauppauge Computer Works in 2000, and Knight continued to work for Hauppauge as the head of Eskape Labs until 2003.

Despite his successful business career, Knight never fully retired from the entertainment industry. He made several appearances on reality TV shows, including The Surreal Life and My Fair Brady.

These shows not only reignited his fame but also contributed to his net worth. Additionally, he launched the online furniture brand Christopher Knight Home in 2012, further expanding his business portfolio.
